why not install ubuntu restricted extras: The way I see it... preload caches all running applications so it knows ten popular applications and is "ready" to load anytime.  And readahead rearrange the boot files to shave a blink.

preload monitors applications that users run, and by analyzing this data, predicts what applications users might run, and fetches those binaries and their dependencies into memory for faster startup times.
By loading them the memory already.
